page.title: 09WIGHTWICK MANOR
page.content: In 1887 Samuel Mander, a wealthy Wolverhampton industrialist bought the old Manor House and Estate of Wightwick. He ordered the building of a new house on the site of the old hall. Built in the period 1887 to 1893 Wightwick Manor is a Half-Timbered house and a notable example of the Pre- Raphaelite style. The Manor contains many original William Morris and Edward Burne-Jones Wallpapers and Fabrics. There are also a collection of paintings by Gabriel, Rosetti, Millais and Madox Brown. Wightwick Manor is a fine source of artistic inspiration. The house is set in beautiful gardens designed by Alfred Parsons with Yew and Holly walks, Terraces, Pools and a Topiary. It is now owned by the National Trust.
